learningpod.title: Kaplan Kids (Vocabulary Acquisition and Use): Context Clues

p.b: The sculptor fused scraps of metal into the shape of shark.

questionBody.p: Based on its role in the sentence, what can you tell about the word fused ?

simpleChoice.p: The word fused is an adverb. It describes how the sculptor worked.
The word fused is a verb. It tells what the sculptor did with the metal scraps.
The word fused is an adjective. It describes the scraps of metal.
The word fused is a common noun. It tells what the sculptor made.
